result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karon Deandre Booker

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Karon Deandre Booker appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Karon Deandre Booker.  Attorney M. Samir Siddique in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense requests resolution date.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 30.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Karon Deandre Booker appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Karon Deandre Booker.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense does not have discovery or an offer. State to send electronic discovery today. Case adjourned for a status conference.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
No driving without a valid license.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Co-Actors Deshaun W. and Niya J.

Defendant Karon Deandre Booker in court.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/16/2022@2pm
